text: Morning team. Back in Singapore. BP this morning was 135/88. Still a bit high.
Thanks for logging that, Rohan. Expected after the long travel. Let's monitor it daily this week as you settle back in. Stay consistent with the medication.
Welcome back, Rohan! How are the energy levels? Ready to ease back into a routine?
Energy is low. Still feeling the jet lag from the last trip. Something light to start would be good.
Completely understand. Let's start with 20-min mobility and stretching sessions for the next two days. I'll send you a new 2-week plan tomorrow that balances recovery and re-building.
Sounds good, thanks Rachel.
Rohan, a good way to help with both BP and jet lag is focusing on potassium-rich foods. Think spinach, avocados, and bananas. Maybe an avocado toast for breakfast?
Can do. I'll pick some up.

Okay Rohan, here is the updated plan. It includes 3x strength sessions (30 mins) and 2x light cardio/mobility days. Let me know how it feels. [DECISION:id=EX-2025-06-02-recovery-plan] New 2-week exercise plan focused on post-travel recovery and strength. refs:['M253','M254']
Got it. Looks manageable.
BP today: 133/86. Sleep score 68. Woke up a few times.
Thanks, Rohan. The fragmented sleep is impacting your HRV, which is down 10% from your baseline. Let's focus on a consistent wind-down routine tonight â€“ no screens 30 mins before bed.
Skipped the workout today. Long day at the office catching up.
No problem, Rohan. The catch-up post-travel is always tough. Let's aim for the mobility session tomorrow. Even 15 minutes helps.
Hi Rohan, just a reminder that your next full diagnostic panel is due at the end of this month. We can start looking at dates that work for you.
Thanks Ruby. My calendar is a mess. Let me check.
BP 130/85. Slept a bit better. Managed the 20 min mobility session this morning.
Great start to the day, Rohan! Well done.
Good to see the BP trending down as you acclimate. Consistency is key.
Just had a big client lunch. Definitely not on the plan, Carla. Will try to have a lighter dinner.
Happens to the best of us! Enjoyed it, I hope? A simple salad with some grilled chicken or fish for dinner would be a perfect balance. And drink plenty of water.
Managed the strength workout. Felt good to move properly again.
Fantastic! That's the one that counts. Have a great weekend.
Weekend was a bit of a write-off. Family commitments. No exercise and eating out.

That's okay, Rohan. Let's look at the week ahead. Your data from last week shows that even one workout and a few nights of good sleep brought your HRV up by Friday. We just need to find that rhythm again.
Easy to say. Hard to execute.
I know. The goal isn't perfection, it's consistency. Let's just focus on hitting today's plan.
Ruby, heads up. I have to fly to New York next week. From the 16th to the 21st.
Thanks for letting me know, Rohan. I'll inform the team. We'll adjust the plan for your travel.
NYC trip noted. Do you know if your hotel will have a gym?
Yes, it should have a basic one.
Perfect. I'll create a simplified travel workout plan you can do with limited equipment.

Rohan, for NYC, focus on simple choices when eating out: grilled proteins, salads (dressing on the side), and try to avoid the oversized portions. I can send a guide for healthy options near your hotel if you like.
Yes please, that would be helpful.
Okay team, we have a plan. [DECISION:id=PLAN-2025-06-09-nyc-travel] Adjusted health plan for NYC travel (June 16-21) including simplified workouts and nutrition guidance. refs:['M277','M281','M282']
Hi Neel, just flagging Rohan's NYC trip. It complicates scheduling his end-of-month diagnostics. He'll be back on the 22nd, likely jet-lagged.
Thanks, Ruby. Let's aim for the 26th or 27th to give him a few days to recover. The blood markers will be more stable then. Dr. Warren will want a clean reading.
Understood. I'll propose those dates to Rohan.
BP 131/84. Workout done.
Consistency! Great work, Rohan.
Hi Rohan, following up on your diagnostics. Would Thursday, June 26th in the morning work for the blood draw at our partner clinic?
Yes, the 26th is fine. Book it.

Excellent. I've booked you in for 8:30 AM on June 26th. You'll receive a confirmation email with all the details, including fasting instructions. [DECISION:id=DX-2025-06-12-q2-booking] Scheduled Q2 full diagnostic panel for June 26th at 8:30 AM. refs:['M290','M291']
Late night in the office. Had to get takeout. Not the best choice.
Don't worry about it, Rohan. One meal doesn't derail progress. Just get back on track tomorrow. Getting enough sleep is more important right now.
Here's the travel workout plan for NYC, Rohan. It's bodyweight-focused with some options if you find dumbbells. The goal is two sessions while you're there. Have a safe flight!
Thanks Rachel. Will do my best.
Landed in NY. Exhausted.
Focus on hydration, Rohan. It's the best thing you can do for jet lag on day one.
Rohan, please try to log your BP in the mornings in NY if you can. The time difference can affect your readings.
Forgot the cuff at the hotel this morning. Back-to-back meetings. Will do it tomorrow. BP feels high.
Morning. BP 138/90. Feeling the stress.
Noted. This is likely situational due to travel, stress, and jet lag. Ensure you're taking your medication consistently. Try to find 5 minutes for deep breathing exercises today.
Client dinner. A steakhouse. Did my best.
That's all we can ask for. Hope you managed to get some veggies in with the steak!
Managed to get a 20 min workout in at the hotel gym. Felt good.
YES! That's a huge win on a busy travel week, Rohan. Well done.
BP 134/88 this morning. A little better.
Glad to see it. The workout likely helped. Safe travels home.
Back in Singapore. Absolutely wiped out.
Welcome back, Rohan. Take it easy today. Rest and hydration are your priorities.
Morning Rohan. Your sleep data from the trip shows significant disruption, as expected. Your readiness score is low. The plan today should be active recovery only - a light walk, nothing more.
A walk sounds about all I can manage.
Post-travel rebound. Let's not be concerned just yet. Your diagnostic is on Thursday, that will give us the full picture of the impact of the last month's travel.
Rohan, gentle reminder about your diagnostics tomorrow at 8:30 AM. Please remember to fast for at least 8 hours beforehand - water is fine.
Got it, thanks Ruby.
For your last meal tonight before your fast, I'd suggest something balanced like baked salmon with quinoa and steamed broccoli. It will keep you full without being too heavy.
Tests done.
Great, thank you for confirming, Rohan! We should have the results back in a few days. Dr. Warren will reach out to schedule a review.
Since the test is done, let's get you back on track with a light strength session this afternoon if you feel up to it. It will help with the lingering jet lag.
No energy today, Rachel. Going to have to pass.
Listen to your body. Rest is productive too. Tomorrow is a new day.

Hi Neel, a heads up for Dr. Warren's capacity next week. Rohan's results are due back soon and he'll need a full 45-min review consult given the likely fluctuations in his lipid panel from all the travel.
Good call. Block two potential slots for him in Dr. Warren's calendar for the first week of July. Let's be proactive on this. We need a clear plan for him for Q3.
Rohan, we have your initial results back from the lab. As anticipated, we're seeing a spike in your inflammatory markers (hs-CRP) and ApoB, likely due to the recent travel and disruptions.

This is not cause for alarm, but it is a clear signal that we need to be very focused on nutrition and consistent exercise in the coming weeks. I'd like to schedule a call next week to discuss the results in detail and map out a strategy.
Figured as much. I've felt off. Let's schedule the call.
Of course, Rohan. I'll coordinate with Dr. Warren and send you some available times for early next week.

Rohan, reviewing your monthly data. We saw a direct correlation between your nights with <6 hours sleep and next-day elevated BP readings. The travel made this pattern very clear. Stabilizing your sleep schedule will be the highest impact change we can make.
I know. The data doesn't lie. It's just hard to control when I'm in different time zones.
We'll work on strategies for the next trip. For now, let's focus on a solid routine here in Singapore.
Morning Rohan. Dr Warren can speak with you on Wednesday July 2nd at 11am or Thursday July 3rd at 3pm. Do either of those times work for your results review?
Wednesday at 11am works.
Confirmed. I've sent you a calendar invitation. [DECISION:id=CON-2025-06-30-q2-review] Scheduled Q2 diagnostic review consultation with Dr. Warren for July 2nd at 11 AM. refs:['M326','M332','M333']

Rohan, ahead of your call with Dr. Warren, I've put together a list of ApoB-lowering food swaps. Small changes like switching to olive oil, eating more soluble fiber like oats, and adding a handful of nuts daily. We can discuss implementing these after your review.
Thanks Carla. Let's see what the doc says first.
Ending the month on a positive note, Rohan? Let's aim for a workout today to build some momentum for July.
Done. Full strength session. Feeling better.
Excellent way to close out the month! That's the mindset. Ready for Q3.
